Properties.Description: Range at which the glow becomes visible. (0 = always visible)
Range at which the glow stops being visible. (0 = always visible)
Change the render color of the glow.
Name of the filter entity that controls which entities can damage us.
If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion that causes the specified amount of damage. See also 'Explosion Radius'.
If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion with a radius of the specified amount. See also 'Explosion Damage'.
Used to limit the amount of gibs produced when this entity breaks, for performance reasons.

Options.Name: Debris - Don't collide with the player or other debris
Enable motion on Physcannon grab (This also applies to the HLVR hand interaction)
Prevent motion enable on player bump
Physgun can ALWAYS pick up. No matter what.

Properties.Description: Delay, in seconds, after 'broken' by pressure before breaking apart (allows for sound to play before breaking apart).
Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins.
Used to disable dynamic shadows on this entity.

Name by which this entity is linked to another entity in a different map. When the player transitions to a new map, entities in the new map with globalnames matching entities in the previous map will have the previous map's state copied over their state.
Name(s) of script files that are executed after all entities have spawned.
The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
The name of this entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Entities with parents move with their parent.
The name of the bone or attachment to attach to on the entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Use !bonemerge to use bone-merge style attachment.
Offset in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Angular offset in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Scale in the local space of the parent model's attachment/bone to use in hierarchy. Not used if you are not using parent attachment.
Whether to respect the specified local offset when doing the initial hierarchical attachment to its parent.
The prop will ignore any damage events if the damage is less than this amount.
Use this to override how far this object casts shadows. 0 = default distance.

Scales damage energy when this object is hit by a physics object. NOTE: 0 means this feature is disabled for backwards compatibility.
Set to 1.0 for materials as strong as flesh, smaller numbers indicate stronger materials.
Used to determine whether or not damage should cause the brush to move.

Properties.FriendlyName: Accept damage from player held objects
Properties.Description: Set to true so the player can bash this with held props.
Scales the angular mass of an object. Used to hack angular damage and collision response.
A scale multiplier for the object's mass.
If specified, this object will start motion disabled. Once its health has dropped below this specified amount, it will enable motion.

Properties.FriendlyName: Physics Impact Force to Override Motion
Properties.Description: If specified, this object will start motion disabled. Any impact that imparts a force greater than this value on the physbox will enable motion.
If specified this object will use this addon behavior when installed in a composite AI
comma-separated list of interaction layers
If set, NPCs will ignore this prop when navigating.
If set, NPC movement will ignore this prop
If set, this prop will automatically convert back to interactive debris after coming to rest as Debris.
If set to a value greater than 0, this item will be removed by the resource balancing system if the player has more than this amount of crafting currency.

InputOutputs.Name: StartGlowing
InputOutputs.Description: Turn on a permanent glow effect for this prop.

InputOutputs.Name: StopGlowing
InputOutputs.Description: Turn off this prop's glow effect.

InputOutputs.Name: SetDamageFilter
InputOutputs.Description: Sets the entity to use as damage filter. Pass in an empty string to clear the damage filter.

InputOutputs.Name: Break
InputOutputs.Description: Breaks the breakable.

InputOutputs.Name: SetHealth
InputOutputs.Description: Sets a new value for the breakable's health. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

InputOutputs.Name: AddHealth
InputOutputs.Description: Adds health to the breakable. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

InputOutputs.Name: RemoveHealth
InputOutputs.Description: Removes health from the breakable. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

InputOutputs.Name: SetMass
InputOutputs.Description: Set mass of this object.

InputOutputs.Name: OnBreak
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this breakable breaks.

InputOutputs.Name: OnHealthChanged
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the health of this breakable changes, passing the new value of health as a percentage of max health, from [0..1].

InputOutputs.Name: EnablePhyscannonPickup
InputOutputs.Description: Makes the breakable able to picked up by the physcannon.

InputOutputs.Name: DisablePhyscannonPickup
InputOutputs.Description: Makes the breakable not able to picked up by the physcannon.

InputOutputs.Name: OnTakeDamage
InputOutputs.Description: Fired each time this breakable takes any damage.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonDetach
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the physcannon has ripped this breakable off of the wall. Only fired if ACT_PHYSCANNON_DETACH is defined in the model this breakable is using.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePreStarted
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this prop starts playing the Pre physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE_PRE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePullStarted
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this prop starts playing the physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using. If the prop has Pre pull anim, this will be fired after the Pre anim has finished playing.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonPullAnimFinished
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this prop has finished playing the physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using. If the prop has Pre & Post pull anims, this will be fired after the Post anim has finished playing.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePostStarted
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this prop starts playing the Post physcannon-pull activity. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE_POST activity is defined in the model this breakable is using.

InputOutputs.Name: Skin
InputOutputs.Description: Changes the model skin to the specified number.

InputOutputs.Name: DisableShadow
InputOutputs.Description: Turn shadow off.

InputOutputs.Name: EnableShadow
InputOutputs.Description: Turn shadow on.

InputOutputs.Name: AlternativeSorting
InputOutputs.Description: Used to attempt to fix sorting problems when rendering. True activates, false deactivates

InputOutputs.Name: SetRenderAttribute
InputOutputs.Description: Set the value of a render attribute used in material dynamic expressions. Examples: $myfloat=0.25 $myfloat4=1.0,0.0,1.0,1.0

InputOutputs.Name: OnIgnite
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this object catches fire.

InputOutputs.Name: RunScriptFile
InputOutputs.Description: Load and execute a script file

InputOutputs.Name: RunScriptCode
InputOutputs.Description: Execute a fragment of script code

InputOutputs.Name: CallScriptFunction
InputOutputs.Description: Call a script function

InputOutputs.Name: CallPrivateScriptFunction
InputOutputs.Description: Calls a script function from this entity's private script scope.

InputOutputs.Name: CallGlobalScriptFunction
InputOutputs.Description: Calls a script function in the global script scope.

InputOutputs.Name: Kill
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity from the world.

InputOutputs.Name: KillHierarchy
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity and all its children from the world.

InputOutputs.Name: AddOutput
InputOutputs.Description: Adds an entity I/O connection to this entity. Parameter format: outputname>targetname>inputname>parameter>delay>max times to fire (-1 == infinite). Very dangerous, use with care.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser1
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser1 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser2
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser2 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser3
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser3 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser4
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser4 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser1
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser1 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser2
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser2 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser3
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser3 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser4
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser4 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnKilled
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the entity is killed and removed from the game.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParent
InputOutputs.Description: Changes the entity's parent in the movement hierarchy.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParentAttachment
InputOutputs.Description: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on its parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParentAttachmentMaintainOffset
InputOutputs.Description: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on it's parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment. The entity will maintain it's position relative to the parent at the time it is attached.

InputOutputs.Name: ClearParent
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity from the the movement hierarchy, leaving it free to move independently.

InputOutputs.Name: Wake
InputOutputs.Description: Wake up this physics object, if it is sleeping.

InputOutputs.Name: Sleep
InputOutputs.Description: Put this physics object to sleep. It will wake if given the Wake input, or if force is applied to it. Note that physics objects go to sleep automatically after coming to rest for a while, so you don't really need to use this.

InputOutputs.Name: EnableMotion
InputOutputs.Description: Enable physics motion/collision response.

InputOutputs.Name: DisableMotion
InputOutputs.Description: Disable physics motion/collision response.

InputOutputs.Name: EnablePickup
InputOutputs.Description: Enable player pickup of this prop.

InputOutputs.Name: DisablePickup
InputOutputs.Description: Disable player pickup of this prop.

InputOutputs.Name: DisableFloating
InputOutputs.Description: Disable fluid/floating simulation to reduce cost.

InputOutputs.Name: SetBodyGroup
InputOutputs.Description: Sets bodygroup. Format is <BodygroupName,index>

InputOutputs.Name: physdamagescale
InputOutputs.Description: Set the Physics Impact Damage Scale for this character. NOTE: 0 means this feature is disabled for backwards compatibility.

InputOutputs.Name: EnableDamageForces
InputOutputs.Description: Damaging the entity applies physics forces to it.

InputOutputs.Name: DisableDamageForces
InputOutputs.Description: Damaging the entity does *not* apply physics forces to it.

InputOutputs.Name: EnablePuntSound
InputOutputs.Description: Allow this prop to play its own sound when punted

InputOutputs.Name: DisablePuntSound
InputOutputs.Description: Prevent this prop from playing its own sound when punted

InputOutputs.Name: SetAutoConvertBackFromDebris
InputOutputs.Description: Set whether or not this prop should automatically convert back to interactive debris after it comes to rest as debris.

InputOutputs.Name: AddAttribute
InputOutputs.Description: Add an attribute with a value of 1.

InputOutputs.Name: RemoveAttribute
InputOutputs.Description: Remove an attribute.

InputOutputs.Name: OnMotionEnabled
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when motion is enabled on this prop, either via 'Health Level to Override Motion' or from the EnableMotion input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnAwakened
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when this entity becomes awake (collision/force is applied to it while it's asleep).

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysGunPickup
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the player picks up the prop with the physcannon or +USE.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysGunPunt
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when a player punts this object with the physgun.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysGunOnlyPickup
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when a player picks this object up WITH THE PHYSGUN. +USE pickups do not fire this output.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPhysGunDrop
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the player drops the prop with the physcannon or USE.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPlayerUse
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the player tries to +USE the prop. This output will fire only if the Generate output on +USE spawnflag is set.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPlayerPickup
InputOutputs.Description: Fired whenever the player picks up this prop (with the physcannon or with +USE).

InputOutputs.Name: OnOutOfWorld
InputOutputs.Description: Fired whenever the prop is out of the allowed world bounds.

InputOutputs.Name: OnPutInInventory
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the player puts the item in their inventory.
